isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT -1991 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: All CELECT vehicles have a yellow "Engine Warning" light and a red "Engine Stop" light located in the tell-tale lights on the instrument cluster. Every time the key is turned to the ignition position, the lights will come on for several seconds as a system self-test and then turn off.

If the warning lights remain on it is an indication that the ECM has detected a problem. The CELECT system can show and record certain problems. The problems are shown as fault codes. The fault codes are recorded in the ECM.

note.para: NOT all engine or CELECT problems are shown as fault codes.

svcproc.title: DIAGNOSTIC SWITCH(S)
svcproc.para: A diagnostic check may be performed using the Diagnostic ON/OFF switch and Idle/Diagnostic INC/DEC switch. Any error codes will be flashed through the red and yellow warning lights. If no errors are found, both lights will stay on while the diagnostics switch is on. Consult the Cummins Operation and Maintenance Manual furnished with the vehicle for exact procedures and fault code information.
To determine the fault codes use, the following procedure:

step1.para: Begin the procedure with the engine off.
Place the switch key in the OFF position.
Turn the diagnostic ON/OFF switch to the ON position.
Turn the key switch to RUN position (not crank).

note.para: Cummins Celect engine diagnostics must be performed with the engine NOT RUNNING. If BOTH yellow "Engine Warning" and red "Engine Stop" come on momentarily and then go out, it is an indication that engine faults are present. If BOTH yellow "Engine Warning" and red "Engine Stop" lights come on and stay on, it is an indication that no engine faults are present.

step1.para: Yellow "Engine Warning" light will flash once.
There will be a one to two second pause.
Red "Engine Stop" will flash code with one or two seconds between digits.

note.para: All Cummins fault codes are 3 digits.

step1.para: Yellow "Engine Warning" light will flash, indicating the end of that fault code, and then start over and repeat the same fault code.
To go to the second fault code, move the IDLE/DIAGNOSTIC INC/DEC switch to the INC position and then release it. The process will then repeat itself as indicated in steps 5 through 8.

To move back to the last or previous fault code, move the IDLE/DIAGNOSTIC INC/DEC switch to the DEC position and then release it. The process will then repeat itself as indicated in steps 5 through 8.
To stop the diagnostics procedure, correct the faults or move the diagnostic ON/OFF switch to the OFF position, and turn the vehicle key switch to the OFF position.

svcproc.para: For example, the yellow Engine Warning light flashes once. The red Engine Stop light flashes: FLASH Digit number one is 1. Then there is a pause. FLASH - FLASH Digit number two is 2. Then there is pause. FLASH - FLASH - FLASH Digit number three is 3. Yellow Engine Warning lamp flashes once. The fault code is 123.
